messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] These lists
messages.msgSnippet: ... There s Alberto VO5 Split Ends Treatment Shampoo for that. Oh, you mean the lists! If there are options and people only use one of them is that the same as
messages.messageBody:
on 7/20/03 9:15 PM, kbcdlovejo@... at kbcdlovejo@... wrote:

> ~Kelly, sorry to have the splits

There's Alberto VO5 Split Ends Treatment Shampoo for that.

Oh, you mean the lists!

If there are options and people only use one of them is that the same as
only having one option?

If the other lists aren't used and this one still is then it does say
something about this list. One thing that it perhaps says is that the things
people dislike the most about this list are the same things that are
responsible for the things people do like.

That's been a pretty obvious conclusion to come to to anyone who has
followed the saga of the "kinder gentler" lists that have been started over
the years as a reaction to this list.

But maybe it's because it's summer. Maybe the traffic on all the HEM lists
is down.

Joyce

messages.subject: These lists
messages.msgSnippet: Has anyone else who s signed on to the other lists notice how little traffic they ve gotten? I don t have one post for any of my new secondary lists in days. I
messages.messageBody:
Has anyone else who's signed on to the other lists notice how little traffic
they've gotten? I don't have one post for any of my new secondary lists in
days.

I think this list is *by far* THE list left for unschooling.

I'm just disappointed it has a new name. Now I can't use
"unschoolingdotcomedians". :-(

~Kelly, sorry to have the splits
